post.summary: Creates a new authentication flow by requesting a password challenge.
Authenticates a user by a first factor.

get.summary: Creates a new authentication flow by requesting a new OAuth state.

post.summary: Creates a new authentication flow by requesting an email (or SMS) for reset password.
Authenticates a user by a first factor for reset password.
Authenticates a user by a second factor for reset password.
Authenticates a user by a second factor.
Requests a challenge for the second-factor authentication.
Creates a proof of work challenge.
Creates a new contact for the current user.
Starts the contact verification flow.

put.summary: Completes a contact verification with verification code for the current user.
Updates the primary contact for the current user.

post.summary: Registers a new device.
Creates machine-to-machine token. This method will be replaced by service account API in the future.

get.summary: Validates the parameters used for OAuth authentication.

post.summary: Creates an OAuth factor of the current user by the response from OAuth.

get.summary: Initiates the process to create external OAuth authentication as the first factor.

post.summary: Creates a second factor of the current user.
Initiates the process of creating second factor.

get.summary: Lists the active sessions of the current user.

delete.summary: Deletes an active session of the current user.

post.summary: Creates a new access token that can be used to access the authenticated APIs.
Creates a new user.

get.summary: Gets the profile of the current user.

put.summary: Updates the profile of the current user.

post.summary: Changes the password for the current user.
Creates a challenge for secure remote password (SRP) for the current user.

get.summary: Gets the user metadata of the current user.

put.summary: Updates the user metadata of the current user.

post.summary: Resets the password.

authapiv1Contact.description: An email or phone number registered by a user.

access_token.description: The access token issued by the server.

refresh_token.description: The new refresh token for obtaining access token later.

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token.

id_token.description: The ID token issued by the server.

temporary_token.description: A temporary token that is used during the authentication flow.
The temporary token to identify the authentication request.

authenticated.description: A boolean that indicates whether session is authenticated.

authenticated_user_id.description: The ID of the authenticated user, or an empty string if the session is not authenticated.

challenges.description: A list of ChallengeType that the client can attempt to complete authenticating as a user.

password_challenge.description:
A new PasswordChallenge if SECURE_REMOTE_PASSWORD is one of the `challenges`. Otherwise, it
will be empty.

authorization_token.description: The authorization token for the user, or an empty string if the session is not authenticated.

proof_of_work_response.title: Response of a Proof-of-work challenge for anti-spam

salt.description: The salt used to hash the password.

B.description: The one-time ephemeral key of the server.

v1PasswordChallenge.description: The SRP challenge from the server.

M1.description: The proof defined by the SRP protocol.

A.description: The one-time ephemeral key of the client.

v1PasswordResponse.description: The SRP response for the username-password pair, under the corresponding challenge.

salt.description: The salt used to hash the password.

verifier.description: The password verifier defined by the SRP protocol.

v1PasswordVerifier.description:
A password verifier of a given username-password pair for the server to authenticate the user
via the secure remote password (SRP) protocol.

temporary_token.description: The temporary token to identify the authentication request.

authenticated.description: A boolean that indicates whether session is authenticated.

reset_password_user_id.description: The ID of the authenticated user, or an empty string if the session is not authenticated.

challenges.description: A list of ChallengeType that the client can attempt to complete authenticating as a user.

reset_password_token.description: The reset password token for the user, or an empty string if the session is not authenticated.

temporary_token.description: A temporary token that is used during the authentication flow.

challenge.description: The selected second factor to authenticate.

user_handle.description: Username, primary email or primary phone number of the user.

device_token.description: A device token that authenticates the device.

user_handle.description: Username, primary email or primary phone number of the user.

device_token.title: The device token that authenticates the device

v1TOTPInfo.description: Information for time-based one-time password second factor.
